meanings.definition: In the direction toward which the wind blows.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed leewards, following the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: She turned leewards to feel the cool wind on her face.
meanings.sent3: The kite flew leewards, chasing the playful wind.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts drifted leewards, carried by the wind of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The leaves rustled leewards, dancing in the wind's embrace.

meanings.definition: The side or region that is sheltered from the wind.
meanings.sent1: We set up our camp on the leewards of the mountain to avoid the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The animals sought refuge in the leewards of the valley during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin nestled in the leewards, protected from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent4: The trees stood tall on the leewards, unaffected by the howling winds.
meanings.sent5: The village was peaceful on the leewards, shielded from the gusts of wind.
